comment._content: Its difficult to comprehend times like this existed .

comment.author: 28967012@N07
comment._content: Very powerful image, more so now than when it was taken.

comment.author: 97332824@N00
comment._content: One of the great American images. People wouldn't believe how segregated America really was, and not just down South, either. I love this photo even though it shows the racial bigotry of the time. It captures such an incredible light, it's amazing. I love vintage advertising, too.

comment.author: 30057424@N07
comment._content: makes you think hard...

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
Door under the stairs says "White Men Only."

Wow.

comment.realname: GR .... home, road -- two places with the same name
comment.author: 33765891@N06
comment._content: let's not never forget were we have come from ..... what we did to our fellow humans.

comment._content: Drinking a bite to eat, black men going in a special entrance dogs and cats sleeping with each other...

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: There's an entrance for "Coloreds" and one for "White Men", where did the women enter?

comment._content: www.ted.com/talks/nina_jablonski_breaks_the_illusion_of_s...

comment.author: 24715065@N02
comment._content: I love that ad. My granddad's furniture store in small town, Oklahoma has almost the same Dr. Pepper ad sponsoring his store.

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: There were separate sections of hospitals, hotels, restaurants, etc in the South even up unto about 1970.  I saw "White" and "Colored" washroom signs in rubble of the old Jennie Sealy Hospital in Galveston, Tx in 1972 and I took them from the rubble and have kept them as reminders of how cruel this country can be.

comment.author: 25053835@N03

comment.author: 25446772@N03
comment._content: At the top of those stairs, to the left was a small concession stand. Pop corn 10 cents, coca cola 5 cents.  I (Joe Abel, BHS '55) worked there while in high school.

comment._content: Does anyone know which exact movie house this is? Or if it is no longer a movie house, where the building is?

comment.author: 25157769@N05
comment._content: The thumbnail shot drew me to this. It was even better when I saw the whole shot. What a shot.

comment.author: 25446772@N03
comment._content: This is the Crescent Theatre in Belzoni, MS. Am not sure if it is still operating.  I am 76 and spent a lot of Saturdays there when I was a boy. So it has been around for a while.

comment.author: 34985608@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the identification, topkick9475! We'll add the theater name to the catalog record next time we update.
